channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024031315
item.description:
Report X-2024031315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being found, the item was brought to QA DescribePack: The box was leaking and contents were also protruding from the box. Upon being inspected, the contents were found to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was sent upstairs causing the cap to become loose and leak. The hazmat was pulled from the belt and nuetralizer was used to clean up hazmat. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose due to improper handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024031186
item.description:
Report X-2024031186

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking plastic pail that was a hazmat, admin immediately put pail in an upright position in a lined tote and used spill pads to clean up small spill that occured. DescribePack: Rim of lid of plastic pail had a gouge in it causing seal to be broken and contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic pail was kept in a lined tote and in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2024031176
item.description:
Report X-2024031176

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was damaged coming out of a trailer during preload. Box looked like it had been dropped, with the plastic pail inside the box coming out of the bottom. The plastic pail was cracked at the bottom with contents spilling out of it. I took it to the Hazmat cage to be processed, completing a DPR, ISF form, and placing the damaged hazmat in a plastic lined yellow drum. DescribePack: Package failed at the bottom of the box that was torn open, due to the plastic pails weight and no inner packaging. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Damaged hazmat was taken directly to the Hazmat cage and started to process.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager found package leaking and called QA. Package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up spill. DescribePack: Once package was inspected a large hole was found in the bag that was containing the liquid inside the package causing most of the product to leak out of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote.

DescribePack: The contents were protruding from the box due to their corrosive nature. When they were inspected, the caps were noticed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024031042
item.description:
Report X-2024031042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT HAD CONDENSATION FORMING ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 15 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE IS A DRY ICE CAUTION STATEMENT ON AN INNER FLAP OF THE BOX, NOT VISIBLE UNTIL AFTER OPENING THE BOX.

item.title: Report I-2024020031
item.description:
Report I-2024020031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: ELIZABETHTOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LEWIS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6310
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver pulled into rack to deliver product. While making turn, the driver caught a piece of angled iron from the rack right at the top of compartment #4 of the trailer. He did no realize what had happened and continued to position truck and trailer for delivery. This movement caused a rip in the inner and outer shell of the trailer allowing product to run out of the trailer. The fire dept. was called and they were able to put down booms immediately upon arrival and contain the product to the concrete apron and the oil/water separator/retention area under the trailer. The NRC was called, KY EPA was contacted along with, a spill response team for remediation and clean up. Lewis personnel responded as well to help coordinate delivery of product still in trailer and make sure clean up was done in timely manner.

item.title: Report E-2024030490
item.description:
Report E-2024030490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: Sedalia
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AUTOZONE TEXAS, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 60944
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 8, 2024 at 5:36am, an AutoZone tractor trailer had the trailer tires go onto a rain softened shoulder causing the tractor trailer to jack knife and ultimately rollover onto the passenger side of the vehicle. During the rollover, the last pallet on the driver side of the trailer (with an electric pallet jack under it) fell on the last pallet on the passenger side of the trailer that contained 24 automotive batteries. The weight of the pallet and pallet jack cracked the plastic case of 10-12 of the batteries releasing approximately 1.2 gal. of battery acid (sulfuric acid) per battery. The acid did start leaking from the trailer until after the tractor and trailer were uprighted were in the process of returning to the roadway. The plastic wrapped pallet containing the batteries contained the leak until the pallet was returned to the upright position and then the acid began leaking through the pallet. The onsite towing company had a response team come and contain the spill, dispose of the damaged batteries and remediate the affected soil.

item.title: Report X-2024031009
item.description:
Report X-2024031009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED 9MM 147GR RN LOW RECOIL (900 FPS) 500 ROUNDS. THESE INNER BOXES CONTAINED LOOSE AMMUNITION WITH SOME POKING THROUGH ONE SIDE OF THE INNER BOXES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE AMMUNITION WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ATL TO SDF PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY.

item.title: Report X-2024030953
item.description:
Report X-2024030953

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While dock walking package was found in a red tote under roller line. Admin picked up package to inspect, found a wet corner and brought it to QA. DescribePack: Once package was opened it was found that one of the bottles had no lid on it and there was substantial amount of product that had leaked out of the bottle into the inside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept up right in a tote before inspection and after inspection lid was put back on and tightened.
